intro: Symplocos simaoensis, commonly known as the Simao stonecress, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan province, where it grows in mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It thrives in acidic soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
